metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0729 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple buffer overflows in (1) internal/XMLReader.cpp, (2) util/XMLURL.cpp, and (3) util/XMLUri.cpp in the XML Parser library in Apache Xerces-C before 3.1.3 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault or memory corruption) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted document.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0729` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxerces-c-samples - 3.1.3+debian-1
libxerces-c3.2 - 3.1.3+debian-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xerces-c package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.3+debian-1').
